author: R Vimal Kumar
text:
It is learnt from the police sources that the photograph of the four accused in the murder of Shankar, a Dalit youth, which got spread through social media, was taken soon after they were nabbed from the terrace of a house at Pattiveeranpatti in Dindigul district.

The release of the picture, before the identification parade of the accused was held, had already invited the criticism of Madras High Court since it could affect the investigation.

The photograph was reportedly taken in the same costumes in which the accused were found sleeping on.

Two of the accused were in undergarments.The location of the photograph and the circumstances with the presence of police personnel holding the accused, are now indicating that the spread of the photograph might have been from the investigation side.

The release of photograph before showing it to Kausalya, wife of Shankar who is now recovering from injuries sustained in the attack, and the prime witness in the case, has been criticised by V. Vigneswaran, brother of Sankar.

Doubts

Mr. Vigneswaran told The Hindu that the family was not fully convinced of the way the investigation was progressing. “We even doubt whether the five were actually arrested or they surrendered to cover up some thing,” he said.

CPI(M) Central Committee member U. Vasuki, too criticised the release of the picture.
title: Release of photograph criticised
